title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Immigration Act 2003
text_raw:
1. 

(1) These Regulations may be cited as the Immigration Act 2003 

(Carrier Liability) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 12 August 2024.

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 8. The Immigration Act 2003 (Carrier Liability) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
8. The Immigration Act 2003 (Carrier Liability) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 

447 of 2003) are revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 13th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [401] 3 

Regulation 3

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: Immigration Act 2003
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

Immigration Act 2003 

Notice of alleged offence under section 2(1)(a)
text_norm: schedule 1 immigration act 2003 notice alleged offence section 2(1)(a)

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 1. To: [insert name of carrier]
text_raw:
1. To: [insert name of carrier] 

In respect of the following passenger: 

Name: [insert name] 

Nationality: [insert nationality where known, apparent nationality to the extent 
that it can be ascertained, or “not known” as appropriate] 

Brought by you to: [insert place of arrival in the State] 

On board: [insert flight number, vessel name, vehicle registration mark etc.] 

Arriving on: [insert date of arrival] at: [insert time of arrival]
text_norm: 1 insert name carrier respect following passenger name insert name nationality insert nationality known apparent nationality extent ascertained known appropriate brought insert place arrival state board insert flight number vessel name vehicle registration mark etc arriving insert date arrival insert time arrival

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the
text_raw:
2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the 
above Act consisting of a contravention of section 2(1)(a) of that Act in that 
at [insert place of arrival in the State] on [insert date of arrival] you did not 
ensure that the passenger, a person on board a vehicle arriving in the State 
from [insert place of embarkation] and seeking (a) to land in the State or (b) to 
pass through the port of [insert place of arrival in the State] in order to travel to 
another State [delete (a) or (b) as appropriate] disembarked in compliance with 
directions given by [insert name of immigration officer], an immigration officer.
text_norm: 2 alleged committed offence section 2 act consisting contravention section 2(1)(a) act insert place arrival state insert date arrival ensure passenger person board vehicle arriving state insert place embarkation seeking (a) land state (b) pas port insert place arrival state order travel another state delete (a) (b) appropriate disembarked compliance direction given insert name immigration officer immigration officer

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 3. (1) TAKE NOTICE, You may, during the period of 28 days beginning
text_raw:
3. (1) TAKE NOTICE, You may, during the period of 28 days beginning 
on the date of this notice, make to the Detective Superintendent (Administration) 
at Garda National Immigration Bureau, 13 - 14 Burgh Quay, Dublin 2 a payment 
of €2,500. 

(2) No prosecution in respect of the offence alleged will be instituted during the 
period of 28 days and if payment is made during that period, no prosecution in 
respect of the alleged offence will be instituted. 

(3) Failure to make payment in compliance of the terms of this notice will result 
in a prosecution. 

(4) Persons found guilty of an offence under section 2 shall be liable on summary 
conviction to a Class A fine for each offence. 

Signed: _________________ 

[name of immigration officer] 

Date: [insert date] 

 
 4 [401]
text_norm: 3 (1) take notice may period 28 day beginning date notice make detective superintendent (administration) garda national immigration bureau 13 - 14 burgh quay dublin 2 payment eur2 500 (2) prosecution respect offence alleged instituted period 28 day payment made period prosecution respect alleged offence instituted (3) failure make payment compliance term notice result prosecution (4) person found guilty offence section 2 shall liable summary conviction class fine offence signed name immigration officer date insert date 4 401

text_raw:
2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the 
above Act consisting of a contravention of section 2(1)(b) of that Act in that 
at [insert place of arrival in the State] on [insert date of arrival] you did not 
ensure that the passenger, a person on board a vehicle arriving in the State 
from [insert place of embarkation] and seeking to land in the State was 
presented to an immigration officer for examination in respect of leave to land.

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the
text_raw:
2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the 
above Act consisting of a contravention of section 2(1)(c) of that Act in that 
at [insert place of arrival in the State] _________ on the____ day of_________ 

[delete all but one of [a], [b], [c] or [d] as appropriate] 

[a] you did not ensure that the passenger, a person seeking to pass through 
the State in order to travel to another state, had with him or her a valid passport 
or other equivalent document which establishes his or her identity, 

[b] you did not ensure that the passenger, a person seeking to land in the 
State, had with him or her a valid passport or other equivalent document which 
establishes his or her identity, 

[c] you did not ensure that the passenger, a person seeking to pass through 
the State in order to travel to another state, had with him or her a valid Irish 
transit visa, 

[d] you did not ensure that the passenger, a person required by law to have 
an Irish visa who was seeking to land in the State, had with him or her a valid 
Irish visa.
text_norm: 2 alleged committed offence section 2 act consisting contravention section 2(1)(c) act insert place arrival state day delete one b c appropriate ensure passenger person seeking pas state order travel another state valid passport equivalent document establishes identity b ensure passenger person seeking land state valid passport equivalent document establishes identity c ensure passenger person seeking pas state order travel another state valid irish transit visa ensure passenger person required law irish visa seeking land state valid irish visa

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: 2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the
text_raw:
2. You are alleged to have committed an offence under section 2 of the 
above Act consisting of a contravention of section 2(3)(a) of that Act in that 
at [insert place of arrival in the State] on [insert date of arrival] you, being the 
carrier concerned of a vehicle arriving in the State from [insert place of 
embarkation], did not, when so requested by [insert name of immigration 
officer], an immigration officer, furnish that immigration officer with vehicle, a 
list specifying the name and nationality of each person carried on board the 
vehicle in the prescribed form.

title: section 3(1) of the Act of 2003 in relation to an offence under section 2(1)(a) of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the fine amounts in the forms of notice to be given to 
carriers alleged to be in breach of offences under section 2 of the Immigration 
Act 2003, as amended by the Courts, Civil Law, Criminal Law and 
Superannuation (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024.
